intro: Lomatogonium pleurogynoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf lomatogonium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. The species is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
